summary: Diff adds a backend removeNews method and a frontend React Query mutation hook (useRemoveNews), plus substantial NewsPage state/handlers for PIN-gated Options and a remove workflow. However, backend deletion is implemented by title rather than an unambiguous/deterministic identifier (e.g., timestamp), which does not meet REQ-5â€™s determinism criterion. Several UI acceptance details (exact titles/labels, absence of date autofill icon/button, presence/location of date-format helper text, and remove selector UI) cannot be fully verified from the truncated NewsPage diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend actor exposes a new update method to remove a specific news item deterministically (using an unambiguous identifier such as the news timestamp).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend removal method removes by `title : Text`, which is not an unambiguous/deterministic identifier (multiple items can share a title) and will remove all matching titles rather than a single specific item.
evidence: backend/main.mo (public shared func removeNews(title : Text) ... news.title != title)
frontend/src/hooks/useNews.ts (useRemoveNews mutationFn takes title: string and calls actor.removeNews(title))
